intro: Fimbristylis platystachys var. typica, commonly known as the broad-stalked sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces dense clusters of small, pale brown flowers, typically arranged in spikelets. It thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
